list_definition.definition: to scatter something over something else in small drops or bits

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He sprinkled salt over his food
He sprinkled the roses with water.

list_ex_of_english: Factual news and current affairs broadcasts are now liberally sprinkled with their influence and interpretation.
She would publicly don her religious habit and walk into the cell as into her grave, while the presiding bishop sprinkled ashes in her wake.
You sit in front of the wench and get sprinkled with oil.
On the other hand, old people and children get a good deal of pleasure in hard weather out of sprinkling these prepared package foods on the lawn or the streets.
The man took the hare to a churchyard and sprinkled the dirt over him, and the hare became his son.
We should stop treating it as though it has to be sprinkled with disinfectant before it is touched, and go for it and make it a splendid success.
The manure is sprinkled over a huge acreage.
I understand that that is the first spot where sand is sprinkled in a freeze-up.
